definition: to move (from one residence to another)
to move/to shift/to change (a position or location etc)/to promote
to reside/to be (in a certain position)/to store up/to be at a standstill/residence/house/restaurant/classifier for bedrooms
(archaic) sentence-final particle expressing a doubting attitude

sentences.english: After dwelling in Rio for ten years, she moved to Lisbon.
sentences.chinese: 她在里约居住了10年之后迁居到里斯本去了。

sentences.english: Over 1,000,000 people were displaced by the Three Gorges Dam project.
sentences.chinese: 由于三峡工程，一百多万居民被迫迁居。

sentences.english: Mother is disclined towards a long distance move.
I decided to pack it in and move to New York.
sentences.chinese: 我决定洗手不干，迁居纽约。

sentences.english: Willing to be relocated in Jiangyin, Jiangsu and work 6 days a week.
sentences.chinese: 愿意迁居江苏省江阴市，每星期为6天工作制。

sentences.english: Recent research shows that forty million Americans move every year.
sentences.chinese: 最近的调查研究表明，每年有四千万美国人迁居。

sentences.english: Nearly everybody came to the housewarming party.
sentences.chinese: 几乎没个人都来参加庆祝迁居的聚会。

sentences.english: They have left this district and gone to live in Bristol.
sentences.chinese: 他们分开这个地域，迁居到布里斯特尔了。

sentences.english: Baiyue Tribe originated from costal regions, and later, the tribe moved inland.
sentences.chinese: 百越族源于沿海地区，后迁居内地。

sentences.english: So do many Chinese who emigrated to the U.S. when they were young.
sentences.chinese: 许多迁居到美国的中国人年轻时也有着相同的想法。

sentences.english: While Mr. Schroeter is fairly content, an eighth move is a real possibility.
sentences.chinese: 虽然萧先生还算满意，第八次迁居也很有可能。

sentences.english: As many as 18,000 Jews moved here.
sentences.chinese: 当时有多达一万八千名犹太人迁居到此地。

sentences.english: We are very pleased to gather here to celebrate the relocation of the head office of the Pudong Development Bank.
sentences.chinese: 我们很高兴相聚在此共同庆祝浦发银行总部迁居新址。

definition: to migrate/to move to a new place of residence
to settle (in some city, country etc)/to take up residence
to move/to shift/to change (a position or location etc)/to promote
to live far away from one's native place/to reside in a foreign country
accompanied by one's dependents/encumbered by wife and children
to make one's home in/to reside in/to inhabit
